Articles.Content: Will we be able to refuel solid rocket boosters?
Gizmos for editing fairings, please. VAB Mode "5" ... ?
I read all of these since i got here, thank you so much!

> 
> **It's not so much a farm any more...**

Awesome. That whole craptacular thing was silly. I'm glad y'all have fixed it.

> 
> It still has the farm aesthetic...

Well, damn.

And thanks again to the OP for providing these reports.
Solid Fuel is a non pumpable resource tho....
Thanks again for the info. I do not like the lines for resources. Also is it supposed to be multicolored? I can barely distinguish colors, is that because of terrain or actually intentional?

I can understand the dislike for the scan-lines. At the same time, I personally like them, and I also liked the dot solution as well.

Comprimise and add both as stock options for the interphase?
I will say that having played with both as they were designed, and playing with them in 3D space, the scan lines have proven to be very nice.

> 
> Solid Fuel is a non pumpable resource tho....

![:rolleyes:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_rolleyes.gif)

Yes. Thanks for reminding us.

10chr

> 
> ![:rolleyes:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_rolleyes.gif)
> Yes. Thanks for reminding us.
> 
> 10chr

Was in response to the fellow asking if ISRU could produce solid fuel.
Thank for this! It's essential for me who always missed the Squadcast

Thanks!

I definitely want that drill.

Drill looks good. Do we have any chance of getting an inline variant?

Also, I hope mining equip will be nice, bulky and heavy. And there won't be some magical engines running solely on extractable resource.
But solid rocket fuel goes through a liquid state before it's set in a rocket casing, doesn't it? You have to mix the roofing tar with aluminum granules somehow. (do NOT try this at home)

> 
> Thanks again for the info. I do not like the lines for resources. Also is it supposed to be multicolored? I can barely distinguish colors, is that because of terrain or actually intentional?

It is color based, but you can change the heatmap colors to your likeness in case it is hard for you to distinguish them

Thanks OWK, great summary as always. Really looking forward to trying out the resource aspects, that drill looks v nice. Do you think we'll get some different sized drills or is that something to just TweakScale?

> 
> Do you think we'll get some different sized drills or is that something to just TweakScale?

I'm in two minds about that, personally. They're mining equipment, they're big, unwieldy and heavy. They're not something that could fit on a tiny rover, for example. So I would understand if it's just the one size. That said, I do like choice and Kethane handled the two drill sizes well - the smaller was still fairly large. I dunno, really.. I can't say I'd prefer 1 size because I want choice and I can't say I want choice because it'll seem silly if I could fit an entire ISRU facility on a Rovemate, you know?
I don't really care for the scan lines. Maybe if they where finer and closer together...
Someone's famous:

> 
> Someone's famous:
Seriously, you're welcome, guys! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> 
> Thanks OWK, great summary as always. Really looking forward to trying out the resource aspects, that drill looks v nice. Do you think we'll get some different sized drills or is that something to just TweakScale?

Is someone planning what I think he's planning? Because I am. I really wanted a drill that would fit on a small rover for my constellation mission..

I wonder what happens if you put a kerbal under the drill....

Just a personal warning from me, Squad:

***Don"t even think about nerfing the aerospike.***

Nerfing? It needs buffing because it's actually underpowered.
